intro: Impatiens parkinsonii, commonly known as the pink impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white, which bloom from summer to fall. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, often with a slightly waxy appearance. Impatiens parkinsonii thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories.
